SEARCH
Package com.quantum.ui.event

Class QEMouseWheelListener

java.lang.Object
com.quantum.ui.event.QEAbstractListener
com.quantum.ui.event.QEMouseWheelListener
All Implemented Interfaces:
GLFWScrollCallbackI, CallbackI, Pointer
public non-sealed class QEMouseWheelListener extends QEAbstractListener implements GLFWScrollCallbackI
Provides an abstraction layer for handling mouse wheel scroll events by implementing GLFWScrollCallbackI.

This class abstracts the handling of mouse wheel scroll events from GLFW by implementing GLFWScrollCallbackI and converting the raw GLFW scroll events into higher-level QEMouseEvent objects. It simplifies the interaction with GLFW by providing the mouseWheelMoved(QEMouseEvent) method, which can be overridden for custom event handling.

In detail:

  • invoke(long, double, double): Processes raw mouse wheel scroll events from GLFW and delegates the event to mouseWheelMoved(QEMouseEvent).
  • mouseWheelMoved(QEMouseEvent): Intended to be overridden to handle mouse wheel scroll events in a custom manner.

Example usage:

 
 glfwSetScrollCallback(window.getWindowHandler(), new QEMouseWheelListener() {

           @Override
           public void mouseWheelMoved(QEMouseEvent e) {
               //Handle scroll event
           }
           
       });
Since:
1.0
Version:
1.0
Author:
RAZANAKOLONA Erwan-Matthieu Liantsoa

  • Method Details

    • invoke

      public void invoke(long window, double xoffset, double yoffset)
      Handles raw mouse wheel scroll events from GLFW and delegates them to the appropriate method.
      Specified by:
      invoke in interface GLFWScrollCallbackI
      Parameters:
      window - The handle to the window where the event occurred.
      xoffset - The horizontal scroll amount. Typically used for horizontal scrolling.
      yoffset - The vertical scroll amount. Typically used for vertical scrolling.
      Since:
      1.0

    • mouseWheelMoved

      public void mouseWheelMoved(QEMouseEvent e)
      Called when the mouse wheel is scrolled. This method can be overridden to provide custom handling for mouse wheel scroll events.
      Parameters:
      e - The QEMouseEvent representing the mouse wheel scroll event.
      Since:
      1.0
